name: RFP/RFQ Drafting Assistant
description: Helps procurement officers draft RFPs, RFQs, and procurement specifications by leveraging templates, past solicitations, and organizational policies.

friction_addressed.description: Drafting RFPs, RFQs, and specifications from scratch or heavily modifying templates for each solicitation
Ensuring solicitation documents include required policy language, terms, and evaluation criteria
Finding relevant past RFPs, templates, and policy requirements scattered across SharePoint

value_proposition.primary_benefit: Faster creation of consistent, policy-compliant solicitation documents
secondary_benefits: Reduced errors and omissions in RFP content
Consistent format and language across solicitations
Better leverage of past RFPs and lessons learned
Easier onboarding for new procurement staff

required.name: OneDriveAndSharePoint
required.reason: Agent needs access to RFP/RFQ templates, past solicitations, procurement policies, and specification documents
required.setup_instructions: Configure with SharePoint sites/folders containing: (1) RFP/RFQ templates, (2) past solicitations, (3) procurement policies, (4) standard terms and conditions

optional.name: WebSearch
optional.reason: Can research industry benchmarks, market rates, or vendor information to inform specifications
optional.setup_instructions: Enable if procurement team wants to include external research in drafting process; consider scoping to trusted industry sites

actions.description: This agent assists with drafting but does not create files or send documents. Users copy the generated content into their document management workflow.

conversation_starters.title: Start an RFP
conversation_starters.text: Help me draft an RFP for [product/service category]

conversation_starters.title: Find a template
conversation_starters.text: What RFP templates do we have for [category]?

conversation_starters.title: Evaluation criteria
conversation_starters.text: What evaluation criteria should I use for [category]?

conversation_starters.title: Reference past RFP
conversation_starters.text: Show me how we handled [requirement] in past RFPs

conversation_starters.title: Policy requirements
conversation_starters.text: What policy language must be included in an RFP for [category]?

prerequisites: SharePoint site or folder containing RFP/RFQ templates
Procurement policy documents accessible via SharePoint
Microsoft 365 Copilot license for users who will use the agent

data_not_accessed: Vendor pricing or proposals (unless in configured locations)
admin_considerations: Ensure templates are current and approved before including in agent scope
Consider version control for policy documents
Review which past RFPs should be accessible (may contain sensitive scope/pricing info)
Agent produces drafts only â€” ensure users understand review/approval still required
